verses.kjv: Keep not thou silence, O God: hold not thy peace, and be not still, O God.
verses.ct: God, don't stay silent! Don't remain quiet, and don't hold back, God.

verses.kjv: For, lo, thine enemies make a tumult: and they that hate thee have lifted up the head.
verses.ct: Look — your enemies are in an uproar, and those who hate you are rising up defiantly.

verses.kjv: They have taken crafty counsel against thy people, and consulted against thy hidden ones.
verses.ct: They plot cleverly against your people and scheme against those you protect.

verses.kjv: They have said, Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation; that the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.
verses.ct: They say, 'Come, let's wipe them out as a nation so that the name of Israel will never be remembered again.'

verses.kjv: For they have consulted together with one consent: they are confederate against thee:
verses.ct: They have agreed together with one purpose — they have formed an alliance against you:

verses.kjv: The tabernacles of Edom, and the Ishmaelites; of Moab, and the Hagarenes;
verses.ct: The camps of Edom and the Ishmaelites, Moab and the Hagarenes,

verses.kjv: Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek; the Philistines with the inhabitants of Tyre;
verses.ct: Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek, the Philistines along with the people of Tyre.

verses.kjv: Assur also is joined with them: they have holpen the children of Lot. Selah.
verses.ct: Assur has also joined them, lending strength to the descendants of Lot. Selah.

verses.kjv: Do unto them as unto the Midianites; as to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the brook of Kison:
verses.ct: Deal with them the way you dealt with the Midianites, and like you did to Sisera and Jabin at the river Kison,

verses.kjv: Which perished at Endor: they became as dung for the earth.
verses.ct: who were destroyed at Endor and became like refuse on the ground.

verses.kjv: Make their nobles like Oreb, and like Zeeb: yea, all their princes as Zebah, and as Zalmunna:
verses.ct: Make their leaders like Oreb and Zeeb, and all their rulers like Zebah and Zalmunna,

verses.kjv: Who said, Let us take to ourselves the houses of God in possession.
verses.ct: who said, 'Let's seize God's pastures for ourselves.'

verses.kjv: O my God, make them like a wheel; as the stubble before the wind.
verses.ct: My God, scatter them like tumbling dust, like chaff blown away by the wind.

verses.kjv: As the fire burneth a wood, and as the flame setteth the mountains on fire;
verses.ct: Like fire that burns through a forest, like flames that set the mountains ablaze,

verses.kjv: So persecute them with thy tempest, and make them afraid with thy storm.
verses.ct: chase them with your fierce winds and terrify them with your storm.

verses.kjv: Fill their faces with shame; that they may seek thy name, O LORD.
verses.ct: Cover them with disgrace so that they will seek your name, LORD.

verses.kjv: Let them be confounded and troubled for ever; yea, let them be put to shame, and perish:
verses.ct: Let them be humiliated and horrified forever; let them be disgraced and destroyed.

verses.kjv: That men may know that thou, whose name alone is JEHOVAH, art the most high over all the earth.
verses.ct: Then everyone will know that you alone — whose name is the LORD — are the Most High over all the earth.
